vision.title: Why we do this
content: AI is growing at lightning speed. Companies that start now gain the lead. Those who keep waiting will soon watch competitors who moved faster.

We believe speed makes the difference. No months of talking about what might work, but tangible results within 30 days. We saw it in our own companies: processes that AI solves in weeks used to take us months. We now apply that experience for others.

We build tools that work immediately. Automate processes, relieve teams, reduce errors. That delivers peace and profit. More output with less chaos. Work more productively, more focus on what truly matters.
But that doesn't happen automatically. It happens by starting. Let's talk.

rob.name: Rob
rob.bio:
In 2018, Rob switched from accounting to Business Intelligence. It was still in its infancy, but he saw the potential. He dove in completely, started freelancing, and soon founded Easydash. An agency that helped companies truly leverage data.

The start was tough. Companies didn't see the point. "We have Excel, that works fine." But as soon as the first results became visible, things moved fast. Within a few years, everyone was using BI tools.

Then came AI. Rob sold Easydash to his partner and stepped into a new world once again. And again he saw the same pattern: skepticism, doubt, waiting. "We don't know if it works." While the frontrunners are already building, learning, and winning.

But AI affects more than reports. It changes entire companies. From customer service to operations, from marketing to decision-making. The impact is bigger, so the urgency is too.

That's why he founded Schakel AI. Not to talk about AI, but to help companies actually apply it. At Schakel, Rob ensures ideas become reality. Rob is a builder who dives deep into technology, masters tools, and builds smart things that really work.

simon.name: Simon
simon.bio:
Simon helped build ROI Financials. Started as an employee, became co-owner after six years, optimized the business, and sold it successfully.

When AI broke through, he saw it: optimizing processes took him months, AI did it in weeks. That opened doors. Keep doing what worked, or fully switch to what became possible? Simon chose the latter.

Not to talk about AI, but to concretely move organizations forward with practical implementations.

What drives him? No patience for theoretical plans that disappear in a drawer. He wants to see processes truly become more efficient. From 20 hours of manual work to automated flows. From error-prone input to reliable systems.

Those 11 years of transformation experience taught him one thing: organizations don't need roadmaps, but concrete first steps. Where others start with strategic analyses, Simon starts with the processes that cost the most time right now.

At Schakel AI, he ensures the focus remains on one thing: results.
